Description:
Famous for its beaches, Sardinia is also cloaked in thick oak
forests and vineyard-filled valleys, with an interior marked by
sprawling plateaus, deep canyons and towering granite ridges.
Scattered throughout are villages, towns and cities, the most
populous of which are near the coast.

SubImages.Description:
Less crowded than more northerly regions, the south is home to
Sardinia’s capital. Cagliari’s elegant architecture lends the city an
easy charm, and its museums provide a fascinating introduction to
the island’s past – a subject that can also be explored at prehistoric
Su Nuraxi and the Roman city of Nora. On the Costa Verde, flamingos
nest in lagoons edged by shifting sand dunes and flowering maquis,
while Baia Chia and the island of San Pietro lure sunseekers with
their gorgeous beaches
SubImages.Name: CAGLIARI AND THE SOUTH
